body.p: When you name a Fever & Rash in the middle of August, I can not but enquire (as soon as I am able) what you are doing to get rid of them, & how you are, since I heard from you. I do not at all expect an answer from yourself; but should be much obliged to you, if you would order Harry or Louis to write me a line of information. I myself am a little better & a little worse for my advice. the heats I felt in a morning are abated, if not gone; and in their room I have got the head-ach, wch with me is a very unusual thing. Adieu! I hope to hear a better account of you.

postscript.p: If you easily get rid of your fever; pray, do not think of going so soon near the coast of Essex.
